properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense Pacific weather system is currently approaching the North Coast. Strong southeast winds have developed and will eventually reach speeds of 80 to 100 km/hr along the North Coast and Haida Gwaii early this morning. The southeast winds will shift to southwest winds this afternoon. The southwest winds will be generally 30 to 50 km/hr but gusts up to 70 are possible. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-09-28T01:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-27T11:37:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2417329622.2020
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense Pacific weather system will bring rain to the North Coast beginning early this morning. The rain will intensify today as the system moves over the region. By Monday morning, rainfall amounts across the inland regions of the North Coast will vary from 50 to 70 mm. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-09-28T03:35:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-27T11:36:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1348744992.2020
Area: North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Kitimat, North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Smog Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: As air quality is back to "fair", a smog warning is no longer required. ###
Expires: 2020-09-27T16:26:10-00:00

Area: Portneuf area, Valcartier - Stoneham area, Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area, Saint-Lambert area, Lotbinière area, Lac-Etchemin area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area, Saint-Georges-de-Beauce area, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Easterly winds of 80 km/h forecast for this afternoon near the Richardson Mountains. A low pressure system approaching from the Gulf of Alaska will move into the Yukon today. Ahead of the low, strong winds up to 80 km/h are expected to develop near the Richardson Mountains this afternoon. Winds are forecast to ease early Monday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-09-28T03:30:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-27T11:31:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2221944769.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. An intense Pacific weather system is bringing rain to the north coast. The rain will intensify later this morning as the system moves over the region. By Monday morning, rainfall amounts across the coastal regions of the north coast will reach near 100 mm. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-09-28T03:35:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-27T11:36:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0946738307.2020
Area: North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locally dense fog across the region this morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-09-27T17:59:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-09-27T12:16:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3974541950.2020
Area: Nipigon - Rossport, Marathon - Schreiber
properties.Author: Environment Canada
